meta.subtitle: Stacks â€” Core Applications (with SVG visuals)

ui.bank_tip: Pick a question. Read the prompt + examples. Use the editor to solve. Teacher Mode shows solutions.
ui.editor_tip: Paste starter code into the editor. Run tests. Submit reply from the Replies panel.

questions.title: Implement Stack (push, pop, isEmpty)
questions.prompt:
Create a Stack class with these methods:

1) push(x): add x to the top
2) pop(): remove and return the top element (return None if empty)
3) isEmpty(): return True if stack has no elements, otherwise False

Use an internal list to store elements.

Your class should behave like a real stack (Last-In-First-Out).
questions.svg_html:
<svg viewBox="0 0 760 220" width="100%" height="auto" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" role="img" aria-label="Stack push pop diagram">
  <defs>
    <linearGradient id="g1" x1="0" y1="0" x2="1" y2="1">
      <stop offset="0" stop-color="#ff9f1c" stop-opacity="0.35"/>
      <stop offset="1" stop-color="#ffb74d" stop-opacity="0.20"/>
    </linearGradient>
  </defs>
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="760" height="220" rx="18" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.65)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>

  <text x="22" y="36" font-size="16" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">Stack (LIFO)</text>
  <text x="22" y="58" font-size="12" font-weight="700" fill="#5b6570">Top is where push/pop happens</text>

  <!-- Stack container -->
  <rect x="60" y="70" width="160" height="120" rx="14" fill="url(#g1)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.22)"/>
  <rect x="78" y="150" width="124" height="28" rx="10" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.85)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="140" y="169" text-anchor="middle" font-size="13" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">10</text>

  <rect x="78" y="116" width="124" height="28" rx="10" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.85)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="140" y="135" text-anchor="middle" font-size="13" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">20</text>

  <rect x="78" y="82" width="124" height="28" rx="10" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.85)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="140" y="101" text-anchor="middle" font-size="13" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">30</text>

  <text x="140" y="78" text-anchor="middle" font-size="11" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">TOP</text>

  <!-- Push arrow -->
  <path d="M 290 96 L 230 96" stroke="#1f2328" stroke-width="3" stroke-linecap="round"/>
  <path d="M 238 88 L 230 96 L 238 104" fill="none" stroke="#1f2328" stroke-width="3" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"/>
  <text x="305" y="101" font-size="13" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">push(x)</text>

  <!-- Pop arrow -->
  <path d="M 230 132 L 290 132" stroke="#1f2328" stroke-width="3" stroke-linecap="round"/>
  <path d="M 282 124 L 290 132 L 282 140" fill="none" stroke="#1f2328" stroke-width="3" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"/>
  <text x="305" y="137" font-size="13" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">pop() â†’ returns top</text>

  <!-- Notes -->
  <rect x="420" y="70" width="310" height="120" rx="14" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.75)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="438" y="96" font-size="13" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">Rules</text>
  <text x="438" y="120" font-size="12" font-weight="700" fill="#5b6570">â€¢ push adds element to TOP</text>
  <text x="438" y="142" font-size="12" font-weight="700" fill="#5b6570">â€¢ pop removes TOP and returns it</text>
  <text x="438" y="164" font-size="12" font-weight="700" fill="#5b6570">â€¢ isEmpty checks if size == 0</text>
</svg>
hints: Use a Python list to store stack items.
pop() â†’ if empty return None else list.pop()

        pass

    def pop(self):

        pass

    def isEmpty(self):

# Tests
s = Stack()
print(s.isEmpty())  # True
s.push(10)
s.push(20)
print(s.pop())      # 20
print(s.pop())      # 10
print(s.pop())      # None
print(s.isEmpty())  # True

questions.title: Parenthesis Matching (Balanced Brackets)
questions.prompt:
Given a string containing brackets () [] {}, determine if the brackets are balanced.

Balanced means:
- Every opening bracket has a matching closing bracket
- Brackets close in the correct order

Return True if balanced, otherwise False.

Ignore non-bracket characters.
questions.svg_html:
<svg viewBox="0 0 760 220" width="100%" height="auto" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" role="img" aria-label="Bracket matching stack trace">
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="760" height="220" rx="18" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.65)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="22" y="36" font-size="16" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">Bracket Matching</text>
  <text x="22" y="58" font-size="12" font-weight="700" fill="#5b6570">Push opening brackets, pop when matching closing bracket arrives</text>

  <!-- Input row -->
  <text x="22" y="92" font-size="13" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">Input:</text>
  <rect x="80" y="76" width="640" height="32" rx="12" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.85)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="96" y="98" font-size="13" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">{ [ ( ) ] }</text>

  <!-- Stack box -->
  <rect x="80" y="128" width="160" height="70" rx="14" fill="rgba(255,159,28,0.12)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.20)"/>
  <text x="160" y="150" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">STACK</text>
  <rect x="104" y="160" width="112" height="28" rx="10" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.85)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="160" y="179" text-anchor="middle" font-size="14" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">{ [ (</text>

  <!-- Rules -->
  <rect x="280" y="128" width="440" height="70" rx="14" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.75)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="300" y="152" font-size="12" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">When you see:</text>
  <text x="300" y="174" font-size="12" font-weight="700" fill="#5b6570">â€¢ opening bracket â†’ push it</text>
  <text x="520" y="174" font-size="12" font-weight="700" fill="#5b6570">â€¢ closing bracket â†’ must match stack top</text>

  <!-- Arrow -->
  <path d="M 210 92 L 260 92" stroke="#1f2328" stroke-width="3" stroke-linecap="round"/>
  <path d="M 252 84 L 260 92 L 252 100" fill="none" stroke="#1f2328" stroke-width="3" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"/>
  <text x="270" y="96" font-size="12" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">scan characters</text>
</svg>
hints: Use a stack for opening brackets: ( [ {
On closing bracket, stack must not be empty and top must match.
At the end, stack must be empty.
questions.starter_code:
def is_balanced(expr: str) -> bool:
    # TODO
    return False

print(is_balanced("(a+b)*(c+d)"))  # True
print(is_balanced("([)]"))         # False
print(is_balanced("{[()]}"))       # True

questions.title: Infix to Postfix Conversion
questions.prompt:
Convert an infix expression to postfix (Reverse Polish Notation).

Rules:
- Operands (letters/digits) go directly to output
- Operators use precedence: * and / higher than + and -
- Parentheses control order

Assume:
- Input contains single-letter variables or single-digit numbers
- Operators: + - * /
- Parentheses: ( )
questions.svg_html:
<svg viewBox="0 0 760 240" width="100%" height="auto" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" role="img" aria-label="Infix to postfix flow">
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="760" height="240" rx="18" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.65)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="22" y="36" font-size="16" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">Infix â†’ Postfix</text>
  <text x="22" y="58" font-size="12" font-weight="700" fill="#5b6570">Use operator stack + output list (shunting-yard idea)</text>

  <!-- Input -->
  <text x="22" y="96" font-size="13" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">Infix:</text>
  <rect x="80" y="78" width="640" height="34" rx="12" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.85)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="96" y="101" font-size="13" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">A + B * ( C - D )</text>

  <!-- Stack -->
  <rect x="80" y="128" width="220" height="92" rx="14" fill="rgba(255,159,28,0.12)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.20)"/>
  <text x="190" y="150" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">OPERATOR STACK</text>
  <rect x="104" y="160" width="172" height="28" rx="10" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.85)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="190" y="179" text-anchor="middle" font-size="14" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">+  *  (  -</text>

  <!-- Output -->
  <rect x="340" y="128" width="380" height="92" rx="14" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.75)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="530" y="150" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">OUTPUT (POSTFIX)</text>
  <rect x="364" y="160" width="332" height="28" rx="10" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.90)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="530" y="179" text-anchor="middle" font-size="14" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">A B C D - * +</text>

  <!-- Arrows -->
  <path d="M 250 174 L 330 174" stroke="#1f2328" stroke-width="3" stroke-linecap="round"/>
  <path d="M 322 166 L 330 174 L 322 182" fill="none" stroke="#1f2328" stroke-width="3" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"/>
  <text x="265" y="164" font-size="11" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">pop ops by precedence</text>

  <text x="22" y="224" font-size="12" font-weight="700" fill="#5b6570">Key rule: before pushing an operator, pop operators with higher or equal precedence.</text>
</svg>
hints: Use a stack for operators and parentheses.
Before pushing an operator, pop operators with >= precedence.
When you see ')', pop until '(' is found.
questions.starter_code:
def infix_to_postfix(expr: str) -> str:
    # Supports: + - * / parentheses, single-letter variables or single-digit numbers
    # TODO
    return ""

print(infix_to_postfix("A+B*(C-D)"))  # ABCD-*+
print(infix_to_postfix("(1+2)*3"))    # 12+3*
print(infix_to_postfix("A*(B+C)"))    # ABC+*

questions.title: Evaluate Postfix Expression
questions.prompt:
Evaluate a postfix expression using a stack.

Rules:
- If token is a number â†’ push it
- If token is an operator (+ - * /) â†’ pop two numbers (b then a), compute a op b, push result

Return the final result.

Assume:
- Expression contains single-digit operands (0â€“9) for this version
- Division should be integer division (truncating toward zero is OK for positive values).
questions.svg_html:
<svg viewBox="0 0 760 260" width="100%" height="auto" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" role="img" aria-label="Postfix evaluation stack trace">
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="760" height="260" rx="18" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.65)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="22" y="36" font-size="16" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">Postfix Evaluation</text>
  <text x="22" y="58" font-size="12" font-weight="700" fill="#5b6570">Scan leftâ†’right. Push numbers. On operator: pop b, pop a, push (a op b).</text>

  <text x="22" y="96" font-size="13" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">Postfix:</text>
  <rect x="90" y="78" width="630" height="34" rx="12" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.85)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="106" y="101" font-size="13" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">2 3 1 * + 9 -</text>

  <!-- Stack -->
  <rect x="90" y="132" width="200" height="110" rx="14" fill="rgba(255,159,28,0.12)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.20)"/>
  <text x="190" y="154" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">VALUE STACK</text>

  <rect x="120" y="170" width="140" height="28" rx="10" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.90)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="190" y="189" text-anchor="middle" font-size="14" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">5</text>

  <rect x="120" y="204" width="140" height="28" rx="10" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.90)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="190" y="223" text-anchor="middle" font-size="14" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">9</text>

  <text x="190" y="168" text-anchor="middle" font-size="11" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">TOP</text>

  <!-- Operation box -->
  <rect x="330" y="132" width="390" height="110" rx="14" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.75)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="350" y="158" font-size="12" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">When you see an operator (example: -)</text>
  <text x="350" y="182" font-size="12" font-weight="700" fill="#5b6570">1) pop b (top)</text>
  <text x="350" y="204" font-size="12" font-weight="700" fill="#5b6570">2) pop a (next)</text>
  <text x="520" y="182" font-size="12" font-weight="700" fill="#5b6570">3) compute a - b</text>
  <text x="520" y="204" font-size="12" font-weight="700" fill="#5b6570">4) push result</text>
</svg>
hints: If char is digit: push int(char).
If operator: pop b then a, compute a op b, push result.
At the end, stack[0] is the answer.
questions.starter_code:
def eval_postfix(expr: str) -> int:
    # expr like: "231*+9-"
    # TODO
    return 0

print(eval_postfix("231*+9-"))  # -4
print(eval_postfix("42/3+"))    # 5

questions.title: Palindrome Check Using Stack
questions.prompt:
Check if a given word is a palindrome using a stack.

A palindrome reads the same forward and backward.

Rules for this question:
- Input is a word (only letters)
- Case-insensitive ("Madam" should be treated like "madam")

Approach:
- Push all characters to a stack
- Pop characters and compare with original order
questions.svg_html:
<svg viewBox="0 0 760 240" width="100%" height="auto" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" role="img" aria-label="Palindrome using stack">
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="760" height="240" rx="18" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.65)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="22" y="36" font-size="16" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">Palindrome via Stack</text>
  <text x="22" y="58" font-size="12" font-weight="700" fill="#5b6570">Push letters, then pop to read reverse</text>

  <!-- Word -->
  <text x="22" y="96" font-size="13" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">Word:</text>
  <rect x="88" y="78" width="632" height="34" rx="12" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.85)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="104" y="101" font-size="13" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">m a d a m</text>

  <!-- Stack -->
  <rect x="88" y="128" width="210" height="92" rx="14" fill="rgba(255,159,28,0.12)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.20)"/>
  <text x="193" y="150" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">STACK</text>
  <rect x="116" y="162" width="154" height="28" rx="10" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.90)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="193" y="181" text-anchor="middle" font-size="14" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">m a d a m</text>

  <!-- Reverse -->
  <path d="M 310 174 L 360 174" stroke="#1f2328" stroke-width="3" stroke-linecap="round"/>
  <path d="M 352 166 L 360 174 L 352 182" fill="none" stroke="#1f2328" stroke-width="3" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"/>
  <text x="370" y="179" font-size="12" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">pop â†’ reverse</text>

  <rect x="470" y="128" width="250" height="92" rx="14" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.75)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="595" y="150" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">Reverse reading</text>
  <rect x="496" y="162" width="198" height="28" rx="10" fill="rgba(255,255,255,0.90)" stroke="rgba(31,35,40,0.18)"/>
  <text x="595" y="181" text-anchor="middle" font-size="14" font-weight="900" fill="#1f2328">m a d a m</text>

  <text x="22" y="224" font-size="12" font-weight="700" fill="#5b6570">If forward == reverse â†’ palindrome</text>
</svg>
hints: Push each character into a stack.
Pop and compare with original character order.
questions.starter_code:
def is_palindrome(word: str) -> bool:
    # TODO
    return False

print(is_palindrome("madam"))    # True
print(is_palindrome("hello"))    # False
print(is_palindrome("RaceCar"))  # True
